::Savanna::

She listened to Phobia.  This history lesson was a bit interesting,  
but boring and time comsuming.  She wanted to get to the point 
faster.  Her patients was just wearing thin.  And how, she wondered, 
does one get a ship off the grouhnd without engines?




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> "The council considers Predicons as expendable tools. Tripredicus 
> doesn't have the sense of fellowship and morality you Maximals 
have. 
> If they want something to happen losses are irrelevant. Especially 
> losses that won't exist after the missions completed. Megatron, 
Hell 
> Beast, Tarantulis, Galvatron, thier all Predacon leaders with the 
> desure to overthrow the council and take control themselves. they 
> were given these types of assignments to remove them from 
opposition, 
> permanently." so if they want us deleted then theres noyhing we can 
> do but succeed or die." The spider can speak of his own kind that 
way 
> because he sees the same aspects in himself. He didn't care about 
how 
> many Maximals or Predicons lost thier sparks, as long as he 
survived 
> is what mattered.
> 
> "These are the files I've obtained on the Predicon ship, I also 
know 
> through reliable sources that Magmatron's out to either capture it 
> for himself or destroy it." Phobia sets files on the table between 
> the others. "The Cybertronian Fire may have the firepower to turn 
the 
> tide of battle. Besides, a ship of this magnifficence should be in 
> space, not stuck on this primitive planet." Phobia knew what 
question 
> would come next, he just wanted to hear Kluster ask.
> (If you don't know the question it's how can we get this ship off 
the 
> ground without engines?)
>
